business.headline: Elon Musk's Tesla likely to begin first deliveries in India from August: ReportThis move comes at a key moment for Tesla. The carmaker has seen sales dip in other countries and is now turning to India, the world's third-largest car market, to reach new buyers.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath hits back at 'dark patterns' used by financial appsNithin Kamath says these tricks are designed to push people into taking actions that are not in their best interest, just so companies can make more money.
Sensex ends 690 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,200; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 689.81 points to end at 82,500.47, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 205.40 points to close at 25,149.85.

New banks coming soon? India eyes first permits since 2014, says reportThe government and central bank are said to be considering multiple steps to create more, larger and stronger banks that can support India's ambitious economic growth plans over the coming decades.

Got Rs 5 lakh health insurance? Should you buy a top-up or higher sum insuredWhen you file a claim, your base policy settles the expenses first. If the bill crosses that limit, the top-up steps in. Normally, your base plan pays up to its maximum, and then the top-up kicks in to handle the rest.
Sensex plunges 700 points: Why the stock market fell 1% today? The S&P BSE Sensex fell nearly 700 points to 82,509.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by nearly 200 points to 25,162.25 as of 12:21 pm.

ITR-2 and ITR-3 excel utilities released: Who can file and what's new?ITR-2 is meant for individuals or Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) who are not eligible to file ITR-1 (Sahaj). This form is meant for taxpayers who do not have any income from business or profession and do not earn any income like interest, salary, bonus, commission, etc.

Bitcoin breaks $117,000 mark, reaches all-time highAt the time of writing at 11.00 am, the world's largest cryptocurrency is trading at $117,863.18, climbing by 6.13% over the last 24 hours. Crypto experts believe if the supportive policies continue, digital coins could see even more new money coming in.

Tesla drives into India: Mumbai to get first experience centre on July 15The space will allow visitors to explore Tesla's electric cars and related technologies, though test drives and deliveries may not be offered at this stage.

TCS falls 2% on Q1 results miss. Should you buy as IT stocks struggle?TCS share price: The IT giant has lost 2.74% over the past five days and declined 4.37% in the past month. Over a six-month period, the stock is down 22.63%.

Explained: Why HUL shares rose 4% todayHUL shares were up 3.8%, trading at Rs 2,500 as of 9;25 am, compared to Thursday's closing price of Rs 2,409.05. The stock ended Thursday's session nearly 1% lower but has gained 3.58% in the past five days.
Sensex opens 280 points lower, Nifty below 25,300; HUL up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.37 points to 82,939.91, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 64.95 points to 25,290.30 as of 9:32 am.

Stock market opening: Weak TCS Q1 results to hamper Sensex, Nifty?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,295 as of 8:30 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 could open below Thursday's closing mark of 25,355.25.
Who is Priya Nair, first woman CEO of Hindustan UnileverPriya Nair will take over from Rohit Jawa, who will step down on July 31, 2025. Nair's appointment will come into effect from August 1, 2025.

IMF praises UPI, says it makes India global leader in fast paymentUnified Payments Interface is an instant and real-time payment system developed by NPCI to facilitate inter-bank transactions through mobile phones.
Sensex closes 346 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 345.80 points to end at 83,190.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 120.85 points to close at 25,355.25.

Dubai dreams under scanner as ED questions homebuyers: ReportMany of the individuals who bought property in Dubai are now under scrutiny as they failed to provide proper bank transaction records showing how the payments were made.

8th Pay Commission may hike salaries by 30–34%: ReportThe 8th Pay Commission could benefit around 11 million people, including about 4.4 million central government employees and nearly 6.8 million pensioners. Once approved, the changes will raise their basic pay, allowances, and retirement benefits.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again? Here's why it mightIn May, the CBDT announced extending the ITR filing deadline, citing big changes in the forms and system readiness. It said that the updated ITRs will make compliance simpler and reporting more transparent for taxpayers.

Zepto, Blinkit, Instamart face a new rival in Delhi's 10-min delivery warThe move brings the e-commerce giant into direct competition with local players such as Blinkit (owned by Eternal), Swiggy Instamart and Zepto, who already dominate the quick delivery space.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe?The bidding window for the IPO will remain open until Monday, July 14. Investors can place bids within the price band of Rs 387 to Rs 407 per share.

When nursery fees need an EMI: CoinSwitch co-founder flags new middle-class crisisOnce believed to be the key to a better life, schooling today has ironically become the heaviest expense for India's middle-class families, who are struggling to keep up, says Ashish Singhal, co-founder of CoinSwitch.

Nvidia now worth nearly as much as India's economy. Details hereAccording to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India's gross domestic product is currently estimated at $4.2 trillion and is expected to touch $4.27 trillion by the end of 2025.

3 key reasons behind Bitcoin's record high todayAt the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $111,019.74, rising by 2.27% over the past day. The last record was set on May 22 when it briefly touched $111,970. Since then, Bitcoin has had a bumpy ride, but it seems to be back with a bang.

TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

Travel Food Services allotment: Step-by-step to check allotment statusInvestors can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to hit $4 trillion in market valueNvidia's market cap now exceeds the combined value of the Canadian and Mexican stock markets. It is also larger than the total market capitalisation of all publicly listed companies in the UK, according to LSEG data.

Emirates signs deal to accept crypto payments for flight bookings: ReportIn recent years, the UAE has grown into a popular place for crypto companies. Many crypto firms have opened offices there or are planning to expand. Today, people in the UAE can already use cryptocurrencies to pay for things like real estate, school fees and even transport services.
Sensex closes 176 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 176.43 points to 83,536.08, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.40 points to 25,476.10 as of 3:47 pm.

Reliance Jio IPO hits pause button, 2025 listing unlikely: ReportReliance Industries shares fell sharply after the news and were down 1.8% in afternoon trade, dragging the broader market into negative territory.

Sebi's ban on Jane Street: Could it rattle Dalal Street?While the ban is focused on a single player, many believe it may have wider effects on liquidity, trading volumes, investor confidence, and even foreign investor behaviour.

71% Indians fear AI scams during Prime Day: ReportPrime Day scams India, AI shopping scams 2025, McAfee Prime Day scam report, Fake Amazon websites India, online shopping scam awareness, AI scam protection tips, Prime Day fake deals warning, Indians fear online scams, cyber fraud Prime Day India, deepfake scams online shopping

Travel Food Services IPO to close soon: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe bidding for the IPO began on July 7 and is set to close soon. Travel Food Services has set the price band for the issue between Rs 1,045 and Rs 1,100 per share.

ITR filing: Who qualifies for zero income tax?In her 2025 Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared big news. Under the new regime, if you earn up to Rs 12 lakh, you will not have to pay any income tax. Salaried taxpayers get an extra benefit too.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro: Will top IT companies gain momentum in Q1FY26?Equirus Securities, in its earnings preview, signals a subdued performance for the sector, where even the heavyweights are struggling to regain momentum.

Mutual fund inflows rise 24% in June to Rs 23,587 crore: AMFI dataAmong the 11 equity mutual fund categories, all except equity-linked savings schemes (ELSS) recorded positive inflows. Flexi cap funds emerged as the most preferred option for investors, bringing in Rs 5,733 crore in June.

9 countries where Indians can get citizenship for less than Rs 1 croreAcross many countries, it is now fully legal to buy citizenship. With a single payment or donation, Indians can get a fresh passport that offers visa-free access and minimal global taxes.

ICICI Prudential Asset Management files for IPO. Check offer detailsThe IPO will be an offer for sale of up to 1.77 crore shares, representing 10% of the company's equity share capital. The shares will be sold by Prudential Corporation Holdings Limited (PCHL), a wholly-owned subsidiary of UK-based insurer Prudential.

entertainment.headline: Director James Gunn calls Govinda's Superman meme the bestAhead of 'Superman's India release, James Gunn shared a special message for Indian fans and laughed over Govinda's viral Superman meme from 'Dariya Dil', calling it "the best." The video, also featuring stars David Corenswet and Rachel Brosnahan, invited Indian audiences to catch the film in theatres.

Top films and shows to watch on Prime Video this weekendPrime Video's new weekend lineup offers a diverse mix of genres, from gripping documentaries and thrilling suspense to action-packed dramas and quirky horror comedies. Indian viewers can enjoy top picks like 'Zero Se Restart,' 'Ballard,' and 'Karate Kid: Legends' for an entertaining and relaxed weekend.

Karan Johar breaks silence on Dhadak 2 delay, praises censor board's sensitivity'Dhadak 2' explores caste-based injustice with a commitment to meaningful storytelling by Dharma Productions. The film's complex certification process highlights collaboration with the CBFC for sensitive content.

Sanjay Dutt on Leo: Loved working with Thalapathy Vijay but Lokesh wasted meAs Sanjay Dutt continues his pan-India journey with back-to-back big-ticket films, the actor recently voiced his disappointment over his limited role in Thalapathy Vijay-starrer 'Leo'.

Does James Gunn's Superman make a subtle commentary on Israel-Ghaza war: ExplainedActor David Corenswet's sci-fi action-drama 'Superman' (2025) has sparked online debate over its subtle commentary on the Israel-Ghaza war. Despite director James Gunn refraining from any kind of direct political messaging, audiences have their own interpretations of the movie.

Why did Salman Khan choose Chitrangda Singh for Battle of Galwan? She answersChitrangda Singh joins Salman Khan in 'Battle of Galwan', a war drama based on the 2020 Galwan Valley clash, directed by Apoorva Lakhia. She calls it a special project, especially because of her army background and a long-awaited collaboration with Salman.

BTS' V shares Paris pics, fans wonder if he's in Seoul or Los AngelesBTS member V's whereabouts spark fan frenzy, with speculation rife over whether he's in Los Angeles, Seoul, or Paris. Here's what we know.

Pooja Hegde steals the show as Monica in Rajinikanth's Coolie second songRajinikanth's 'Coolie' latest song 'Monica' featuring Pooja Hegde delivers a vibrant dance performance. The energetic track, backed by Anirudh Ravichander's beats and a star-studded cast, promises a grand release on August 14, 2025.

Maalik review: Rajkummar Rao enjoys the gritty role, sadly, audiences don'tRelease Date:Fri Jul 11, 2025Maalik movie review: The film showcases Rajkummar Rao's gritty portrayal of an underworld don in the 80s Prayagraj. Despite strong performances, the film struggles with clichéd storytelling and emotional disconnect.

F1, Jurassic Park prove fans pay for premium entertainment despite high ticket ratesThe recent success of Hollywood films like 'Jurassic World' and 'F1' in India shows that audiences are willing to pay higher ticket prices for a premium cinematic experience despite previous concerns about affordability. Industry experts believe that strong content and immersive formats are reviving theatre business.

Son of Sardaar 2 trailer reaction: Ajay trolls Pakistan, sparks mixed fan buzzThe trailer of Ajay Devgn and Mrunal Thakur-starrer 'Son of Sardaar 2' was unveiled today. The film also stars Ravi Kishan, Sanjay Mishra, Neeru Bajwa and Chunky Panday.

Is KATSEYE the next BLACKPINK or are we asking the wrong question?K-pop's newest sensation, KATSEYE, is climbing the charts and redefining fashion. This week on K-fix, we ask, is BLACKPINK finally facing real competition?

Fatima Sana Shaikh recalls being harassed, says just being a girl is enoughActor Fatima Sana Shaikh opened up about being physically assaulted after confronting a man who touched her inappropriately, highlighting the fear and caution women are forced to live with. She also recalled facing harassment during the Covid-19 lockdown, stressing how simply being a woman invites such behaviour.

Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan review: Shanaya makes promising debut in predictable plotRelease Date:Fri Jul 11, 2025'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan' movie review: Actor Shanaya Kapoor makes an impressive debut in director Santosh Singh's 80s-themed love story. Despite Kapoor's acting potential and Vikrant Massey's convincing portrayal, the film falters due to cliched storytelling.

Karan Johar hits back at health and weight-loss rumours: I'm alive, will stay aliveFilmmaker Karan Johar dismissed health concerns at the 'Dhadak 2' trailer launch. He said his weight loss is attributed to a revamped wellness routine, not health issues. Johar said he intends to live healthily for his children and his future projects.

BLACKPINK returns with high-energy single Jump after three yearsBLACKPINK has made a powerful comeback with their new single Jump after a three-year group hiatus. The release coincides with the launch of their ambitious Deadline World Tour across multiple continents.

Dhadak 2 trailer: Siddhant, Triptii battle caste and conflict in important filmSiddhant Chaturvedi and Triptii Dimri starrer 'Dhadak 2' trailer is out. Directed by Shazia Iqbal, the film will release in theatres on August 1.

Sanjay Dutt on The Raja Saab and Dhurandhar clash: I hope they don'tSanjay Dutt, who is part of both 'The Raja Saab' and 'Dhurandhar', has expressed concern over the films releasing on the same day. While promoting 'KD – The Devil', the actor spoke about his roles, bonding with Prabhas, and his admiration for Telugu cinema.

general news.headline: Tennis star's father contemplated taking own life before killing daughter: SourcesBefore the fateful day, Deepak Yadav spoke to his daughter Radhika several times and asked her to shut down her tennis academy.
Earthquake tremors jolt Delhi-NCR, second time in two daysA 3.7 magnitude earthquake struck Haryana's Jhajjar at 7.49 pm on Friday, with tremors being felt in neighbouring Delhi-NCR region.

Semi-finals live: Sinner wins 2nd set vs Djokovic, Alcaraz waits in finalWimbledon semi-finals Live Updates: Jannik Sinner has won the second set against Novak Djokovic and is a set away from qualifying for the final. Earlier in the day, Carlos Alcaraz beat Taylor Fritz in four sets on Centre Court on Friday.

3rd Test, Day 2 Live: Pant, KL counterattack after Gill fallsIND vs ENG, Lord's Test Day 2 Live Score: Shubman Gill's incredible form doesn't continue at Lord's as Chris Woakes gets the big breakthrough to bring England back into the contest. Rishabh Pant joins KL Rahul in the middle as India look to stabilise the innings.

Why is the Election Commission interfering in the election process?The Election Commission, the guardian of fairness, is stooping to their statutory duty. It's shocking to see a constitutional authority interfering in the democratic process. Next, they'll tell us elections should be won by clean, spotless politicians without spending beyond the statutory limit.

Carlos Alcaraz keeps three-peat dream alive, storms into finalWimbledon 2025: Five-time Grand Slam champion Carlos Alcaraz marched into the men's singles final at the All England Club after beating the USA's Taylor Fritz 6-4, 5-7, 6-3, 7-6 (8-6) in the semi-final on Centre Court.

Isro chief reveals how India saved Shubhanshu Shukla from disasterThe launch, originally scheduled for June 11, was called off on the evening of June 10 after ISRO's team detected a leak and later a crack in the Falcon 9 booster.

Will Congress pick Shashi Tharoor's dare on Emergency 'excesses'?His remarks have triggered a new political storm and feed into the BJP's narrative of the Emergency as the darkest chapter in modern Indian history

Did Godse also kill Gandhi's chance of getting the Nobel Peace Prize?Though nominated five times, Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi never won the Nobel Peace Prize. On the shortlist in 1948, Gandhi was assassinated by Nathuram Godse, just days before the committee's final decision. The Nobel Peace Prize wasn't awarded in 1948 as "there was no suitable living candidate".

Bumrah breaks Kapil Dev's record, registers most away 5-wicket hauls for IndiaFast bowler Jasprit Bumrah broke Kapil Dev's record as he registered the most five-wicket hauls away from home for India, with his marvellous bowling spell on Day 2 of the third Test at Lord's.

Video shows Sena MLA Sanjay Shirsat with bag full of cash day after tax noticeIn the video, Maharashtra Social Justice Minister Sanjay Shirsat can be seen sitting in his bedroom smoking a cigarette and a bag containing a stash of cash is open beside him. Another suitcase is visible nearby.

Elon Musk's Tesla likely to begin first deliveries in India from August: ReportThis move comes at a key moment for Tesla. The carmaker has seen sales dip in other countries and is now turning to India, the world's third-largest car market, to reach new buyers.

Idhar kafi restrictions hai, wanna enjoy life: Radhika's chats with tennis coachIndia Today has accessed Radhika Yadav's WhatsApp chats with her coach where she mentioned 'restrictions' and said she wanted to enjoy life.

Neeraj Chopra working on new technique for bigger throwsDouble Olympic medallist Neeraj Chopra is working to perfect his new technique under coach Jan Zelezny. He aims to improve consistency to throw bigger distances.

FBI using lie detectors to test agents' Trump loyaltySince Kash Patel became FBI director, the bureau has expanded its use of polygraph tests to root out internal critics and leakers, with some employees questioned about speaking negatively of Patel. Former officials call the move politically charged, warning it undermines morale, silences dissent, and prioritises loyalty over competence.

Why Bengal BJP's new chief has taken a new tone on Muslims, CommunistsBJP Rajya Sabha MP Samik Bhattacharya, an old RSS hand, has assumed charge as the party chief of West Bengal ahead of the crucial Assembly election in 2026. Bhattacharya has surprised many by his outreach to Muslims and Communists. Is there a lesson from 2019 and the Kaliganj bypoll behind this?

Flyers stuck on remote US island for 31 hours after Delta flight engine glitchFlight 127, an Airbus A330 carrying 282 passengers and 13 crew members, departed Madrid on Sunday en route to John F Kennedy International Airport but diverted to Lajes Airport in the Azores (TER) following a mechanical issue with one of its engines.

Indian Super League put on hold, 2025-26 season in doubtThe Indian Super League (ISL) has been put on hold, the Football Sports Development Limited (FSDL) told the clubs and the All India Football Federation (AIFF) on Friday, July 11.

Case against YouTuber for bike stunts in restricted zones of Ladakh's Pangong LakeA YouTuber has been booked under Sections 125 and 292 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS) 2023 for performing stunts near Pangong Lake and in the Nubra sand dunes, both of which are protected zones due to their fragile ecosystems.

Aap Jaisa Koi review: Madhavan-Fatima's love story is a dull Rocky Aur Rani...Release Date:Fri Jul 11, 2025Aap Jaisa Koi wants to be bold, progressive, and conversation-starting. But somewhere between intent and execution, this R Madhavan and Fatima Sana Shaikh film loses its spark.

Man retires at 45 with Rs 4.7 crore by investing early in SIP, nephew shares storyOn Reddit's r/IndianStockMarket page, the user shared a post titled "He retired at 45 with Rs 4.7 crore," where he recounted the story of his uncle who managed to build his impressive retirement corpus.
2 Mumbai teens kidnapped, assaulted, forced to perform oral sex over unpaid loanWhile the prime accused, identified as Dilip Goswami, has been arrested, the other three accused are on the run.

Man bites off wife's nose in Karnataka during argument over loan repaymentA woman in Karnataka's Shivamogga was injured when her husband bit off part of her nose during a fight over a loan. Locals rushed her to hospital, and police registered a case based on her complaint.

Lord's turns red on Day 2 to support Strauss Foundation and raise fundsLord's - the Home of Cricket - once again turned red for the Ruth Strauss Foundation's annual #RedforRuth day, held on the second day of the third Test between India and England.

Not a surface to come out swinging: Pope on England's slow batting approachENG vs IND: Ollie Pope explained why England decided to opt for a slow batting approach in the opening day of the Lord's Test. He suggested that the surface used and India's bowling lengths resulted in the batters being unable to freely attack, resulting in a slow scoring day.

Dinesh Karthik takes fans on heartfelt tour of MCC Museum at Lord'sFormer Indian cricketer Dinesh Karthik recently gave fans a personal tour of the MCC Museum at Lord's. He highlighted the 1983 World Cup display, including Kapil Dev's jersey and a replica of the trophy, giving a close-up look at one of Indian cricket's most iconic moments.

England took a different approach: Trott credits hosts' classical battingJonathan Trott praised England's smart, disciplined approach as they hit pause on Bazball and adapted to the testing conditions at Lord's. Led by a patient 99 from Joe Root, it was a day marked by maturity and control rather than explosive strokeplay.

Mitchell Starc reflects on journey to 100 Tests: It makes me feel oldMitchell Starc joked that it makes him feel old as he reflected on the remarkable journey to his 100th Test. He is set to become just the second Australian fast bowler, after Glenn McGrath, to reach the milestone.

India should persist with him: Kumble backs Nitish Reddy's all-round skillENG vs IND: Anil Kumble feels that India should give Nitish Kumar Reddy an extended run in Test cricket. He believes that there is a lot of talent in the 22-year-old and is more than capable of delivering with bat and ball in the longest format.

ENG vs IND: Bazball shutdown, but was it really India's day at Lord's?Day 1 of the Lord's Test saw England being forced to mute Bazball and go for the traditional approach. While India forced the hosts to move away from their usual style, did they actually win the day in the end?

Wimbledon mixed champion Verbeek gets crowd to sing Happy Birthday to dadSem Verbeek marked his first Grand Slam title at Wimbledon 2025 with a special gesture, leading Centre Court in singing 'Happy Birthday' to his father moments after winning the mixed doubles final alongside Katerina Siniakova.

Joe Root has inspired everyone, hope he completes his hundred on Day 2: PopeEngland vice-captain Ollie Pope praised Joe Root for his inspirational presence in the dressing room and expressed hope that the star batter would complete a well-deserved century on Day 2 of the third Test against India at Lord's.

Tottenham Hotspur complete Mohammed Kudus signing from West Ham UnitedTottenham Hotspur have bolstered their squad by signing Mohammed Kudus from West Ham for €55 million, making a bold start to their 2025–26 campaign under new manager Thomas Frank and aiming for silverware on all fronts.

Wiaan Mulder reveals Brian Lara's message: Should've gone for the 400Wiaan Mulder declared on 367 in South Africa's dominant win over Zimbabwe, falling short of Brian Lara's iconic 400. But Lara later told Mulder he should've gone for it and backed him to try again.

How Amanda Anisimova defied mental health battles to rediscover herselfWimbledon: After dropping out of the top 400 of the WTA rankings since her mental health break two years ago, Amanda Anisimova is on the cusp of her maiden Grand Slam and will look for glory when she faces Iga Swiatek in the final.

Ireland's Curtis Campher becomes first man to take five wickets in five ballsIreland all-rounder Curtis Campher etched his name into the history books on Thursday, becoming the first male cricketer in professional cricket to take five wickets in five consecutive deliveries.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
